alert.note: Alert for Craig; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 13 at 6:27AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory this morning, very cold wind chills to as low as 10 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory tonight, very cold wind chills to as low as 20 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible Sunday and Monday night. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Osage, Washington OK, Nowata, Craig and Pawnee Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
